children.value: Simple trade strategy expands upon Perform Trade strategy. By the end of this part, you should be able to add:
set a time restriction to cancel order
Check for readiness and connection status of markets with
If all markets are ready, call
NOTE : Can change tick interval by specifying
Ensure that there is a given amount of time in between the trades.
If there is an order to place, check that current timestamp is greater than previous order's timestamp plus delay time (e.g. current timestamp > previous order's start timestamp +
If current time is valid time to place orders, call
NOTE : Can change delay interval by specifying
Cancel orders once their elapsed times go over a certain amount.
If there are active orders, check if order needs to be canceled (e.g. current_timestamp >= order's start timestamp +
If an order has to be canceled, call
NOTE : Can change cancel interval by specifying
When a specific event about the order is triggered, the event handler calls these logging methods to provide helpful information to the users.
sees that an order is filled.
sees that a buy order is completed.
sees that a sell order is completed.
These functions check to see if the order of interest is market or limit order and outputs appropriate text for each types.
Similar mechanisms can be implemented for the following existing event listeners:
